moves.3. c3: Protecting my king and threatening the bishop
moves.3... Ba5: Moving the bishop out of danger
moves.4... Bb6: Moving the bishop out of danger
moves.5... Nc6: Black fails to see the danger the bishop is in
moves.10. Bd2: Moving the bishop out of danger
moves.12. Bg5: Threatening the knight and the pawn at the same time
moves.14. gxh3: Because the rook is no longer protecting the pawn, I can now take it
moves.15. Bc4: Moving my bishop back out; this was not the best move because of the pesky little pawn on b6.
moves.15... b5: Threatening both my queen and bishop.
moves.16. Bxb5: If I'm going to lose my bishop anyway, might as well lessen the blow.
moves.19. Nbd2: Moving my other knight into the fray and aiming for the pawn on f6.
moves.19... Kg7: Black sees through my strategy and protects the pawn
moves.20. Nc4: Now I am aiming for Black's bishop
moves.21. h4: Moving the pawn up so it is protected by the knight
moves.21... d5: Threatening my knight and forcing my hand
moves.22... Qc6: I would not have done this if I were Black; even if it is to get rid of my queen, it's not really a good idea to trade queens if you're down in pieces.
moves.25. Nd2: At this point, I didn't know what else to do, so I did this.
moves.26. Nb3: Planning to demolish his little army of pawns
moves.27... Rh8: Moving the rook back to prevent promotion of pawns
moves.28. h4: Moving my other pawn out. At this point, I figure that the first pawn that reaches the opposite end will become a rook, which will get rid of his rook, and then the other pawn can become a queen.
moves.29. Nc5: Moving my knight out of danger
moves.30. Nd3: Protecting the pawn and threatening the rook
moves.30... Rb3: Moving the rook out of danger and threatening the knight
moves.31. Nc5: Moving the knight out of danger
moves.31... Rb4: I don't know why Black did this.
moves.32. a5: Moving my pawn forward to try to promote it
moves.32... Rb8: Trying to prevent me from promoting my pawns
moves.33... Ra8: Blocking the a-column pawn from promotion
moves.34... Kh6: Blocking me from moving that pawn
moves.35. Nd7: Aiming for the pawn on f6
moves.36. Ne5: Now I am aiming for the pawn on f7; even if he sees what I'm doing and moves that pawn, I can still easily take the c6 pawn instead
moves.39. Nxf7+: I take the pawn and put Black in check
moves.40. Ng5: Now I am aiming for the pawn on e.
moves.40... Kh6: Black moves the king; if I were in this position, I'd actually do Kf6 to protect the back pawn and threaten the knight.
moves.41... Rxa7: All hope is lost for Black.
moves.43. Nxd4: I take the pawn and Black resigns
